overview:
Jamie is an experienced startup executive and creative entrepreneur specializing in social media, marketing, international development and digital entertainment. Her expertise in brand building through innovation, technology and revenue has defined her diverse experiences in the digital, political and non-profit sectors. She has a passion for working at the heart of great transformation between brands, technology, and consumers.

in 2010, Jamie co-founded Gobbler with her brother Chris. Gobbler is revolutionary asset cataloging, backup and collaboration service built for media professionals. She is also currently an advisor to Soundcloud, Metrolyrics and For Your Art.

Until late 2009, Jamie served in several roles throughout Myspace/Fox Interactive Media. In her last role as SVP, Strategy and Global Marketing, she oversaw the music service’s platform of original programming, artist strategy, and marketing. Prior to this role, Jamie served as SVP, International Marketing and Content based in London, UK. She played an integral role in overseeing MySpaceâ€™s expansion into 30 international territories. Jamie joined the company in 2004 as VP of Marketing and Content. She was responsible for the development and launch of MySpaceâ€™s entertainment properties, including MySpace Music, Comedy, Film, Events and Impact and created and managed strategic marketing and partnerships.

For her innovative work at MySpace, Jamie has been previously placed on Ad Ageâ€™s Top 50 Marketers and Billboard Magazineâ€™s â€œ30 Under 30 to Watchâ€.

A pioneer in the digital and social media space, Jamie has worked with thousands of brands and artists to help them integrate, understand and leverage new technologies and connect them with both young and saavy audiences.

A native of the Los Angeles area, Jamie graduated from Emory University.
